conservation and land use</topcClas>         <topcClas>Leisure, tourism and sport - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The survey was undertaken in order to assess the task of legally defining the network of public rights of way, maintaining and publicising them.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br> Variables<br> Status of link; representation as right of way; length; whether signposted, waymarked; ease of finding start; clarity of direction of route; crossings (stile/gate/bridge); surface quality; hazards or obstacles; ease of following and use; erosion; scenic quality; character of area; edge of area; dead end.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd National Grid</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Paths</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Roads</universe>         <universe>Public paths, including bridleways and byways, in
